intro: Alsine verna lusus macropetala, commonly known as the large-petaled sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions.
